content: Yes, the artwork for David Bowie's "Aladdin Sane" album was designed by the British artist and designer Brian Duffy. Duffy was an important figure in the British art and design scene in the 1960s and 1970s, and he worked on many iconic album covers of the era. The cover for "Aladdin Sane" is one of his most famous works, and it features an iconic image of David Bowie with a lightning bolt painted on his face. This design has become synonymous with Bowie's persona and has played a significant role in shaping his visual identity. The cover is known for its striking colors, bold typography, and memorable imagery, which are all characteristic of Duffy's unique artistic style.
